page.title: 08BUCKNALL SCHOOL - WHAT WE DO
page.content:
{MY SCHOOL - BY DAVID KIRK (age 10)
Our school is roughly 10 metres by 5 metres and has some 45 children in the whole school having 26 in the junior class and 19 in the infant class which has recently had a facelift- knocking down part of the wall and making that part of the building an open planned classroom. I am in the fourth year juniors which is the last year for children going to the school at the moment. The starting age for the youngest children is either 4 or 5 depending on the choice of the parents. The leaving age is always 10 or 11 with the parents having no choice in the affair whatsoever. The mathematics scheme is a very modern scheme and has nice shiny educational pictures in that make maths less gloomy than it would be otherwise.
